Welcome to Vitprog’s documentation!¶

vitprog backend¶

vitprog backend.blurring¶

class backend.blurring.blur(path, color=False)¶

This class describes a blured image.

This contains all the functions needed to blur a image over multiple iterations

Parameters

  • path (str) – path to a image file

  • color (bool) – if the image should be shown with colors

fit(epochs)¶

Makes multiple iterations of the method

Calls iteration as many times as spesifed in by the parameter epochs

Parameters

epochs (int) – The iteration count

iteration()¶

Does one iteration of the method.

vitprog backend.contrasting¶

class backend.contrasting.contrast(path, color=False)¶

This class describes a contrast image.

This contains all the functions needed to improve the contrast of a image over multiple iterations

Parameters

  • path (str) – path to a image file

  • color (bool) – if the image should be shown with colors

fit(epochs=1)¶

Makes multiple iterations of the method

Calls iteration as many times as spesifed in by the parameter epochs

Parameters

epochs (int) – The iteration count

iteration()¶

Does one iteration of the method.

vitprog backend.demosaicing¶

class backend.demosaicing.demosaic(path, color=True)¶

This class describes a demosaic image.

This contains all the functions needed to perform demosaic on a image over multiple iterations

Parameters

  • path (str) – path to a image file

  • color (bool) – if the image should be shown with colors

fit(epochs=1)¶

Makes multiple iterations of the method

Calls iteration as many times as spesifed in by the parameter epochs

Parameters

epochs (int) – The iteration count

iteration()¶

Does one iteration of the method.

simulate()¶

Simualtes a image into a state where we can preform demosaic

vitprog backend.matting¶

class backend.matting.matting(target_path='./files/test_images/target.png', source_path='./files/test_images/source.png', color=True)¶

This class describes a matting image.

This contains all the functions needed to merge a image over another image over multiple iterations

Parameters

  • target_path (str) – path to the target image

  • source_path (str) – path to a souce image to add on the target

  • color (bool) – if the image should be shown with colors

Calls iteration as many times as spesifed in by the parameter epochs

destroy_information(strength=2)¶

Destroys parts of the image

Parameters

strength (int) – a number from 1 to 10, this is used to set the level of noise added

fit(original=None, data=None, mask=None, epochs=1)¶

Makes multiple iterations of the method

Calls iteration as many times as spesifed in by the parameter epochs

Parameters

  • original (ndarray) – The original version of the image

  • data (ndarray) – Set current data (TODO : MAKE BETTER NAME)

  • mask (ndarray) – Set mask of the image

  • epochs (int) – The iteration count

vitprog gui.interface¶

class gui.interface.interface_class¶

A more abstract way to make a QT window

add_button(text, action, setEnabled=True)¶

Creates a QPushButton

Parameters

  • text (str) – set the QPushButton text

  • action (lambda) – set action of the QPushButton

  • setEnabled (bool) – if should the button be enabled from start

Returns

the QPushButton with the given action

Return type

QPushButton

add_image(data, parse)¶

Creates a QLabel with a image

Parameters

  • data (ndarray) – the image

  • parse (lambda) – a function used to parse the image to a QT compatible format

Returns

  • QLabel – the QLabel with a image

  • QPixmap – the pixmap of the image

add_label(text)¶

Creates a QLabel

Parameters

text (str) – set the QLabel string

Returns

the QLabel with the text

Return type

QLabel

  • element_id (str) – a id given to the element

Returns

a QComboBox with all the windows

QComboBox

  • int – the max width of a element

update_geometry(height, width, element_id=None, x=0, y=-1)¶

Update the geometry

of the last image or one specified

Parameters

  • heigth (int) – set the height of a image

  • width (int) – set the width of a image

  • element_id (str) – the element_id to check against

  • x (int) – sets the x position

  • y (int) – sets the y position
